title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [23 march 1873]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [23 March 1873]
text: My dear Walti received your letter yesterday we got the papers you send walterWalter dear i am glad you gain a little the weather here is very disagreabledisagreeable dark and dreary just so i feel at times dark and dreary i suppose every body has theiretheir good feelings and bad ones) i have been writing to Jeff and speaking about mattyMatty makes me always feel so down hearted she was so good to me i cantcan't never get reconciled to her loss never shall i find her kindness from daughter or daughter inlawdaughter-in-law but she sshe's gone poor soul i was glad you got a letter from Jeff i wish he would write to me i suppose he is very busy with his extra work georgeGeorge too is on seems to be full of business mrMr. Lane has empowered him to oversee his work at florenceFlorence and glowcesterGloucester so i dontdon't think georgeGeorge will suffer for the want of employment if he didentdidn't get the brooklynBrooklyn work starrStarr didentdidn't put in a bill for the brooklynBrooklyn work so its done away at eastonEastonLou sLou's aunt is here has been here sometime and will stay i suppose somtimesome time louLou likes to have her here very much i suppose so we drift along walterWalter dear some is wanted and some aintain't but we shall all get to our final resting place some day)good bie dear waltWaltwe will all hope for the bestthis aintain't a very cheerfullcheerful letter i dontdon't feel much like writing a good letter so dontdon't send this to han (i am pretty wellwrite as often as you can dear waltWalt Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [23 March 1873]
